chapter.title: Installing the redBorder Enterprise Edition IPS

section.title: What is an IDS?
section.para: IDS is an Intrusion Detection System to protect one or more organization network.
It is a specific software that runs in the user space and analyze network traffic (using a mirror port or SPAN) in one system interface or between two interfaces joined as a bridge (software switch).
The traffic is analyzed looking for anomalies, specific signatures or suspicious behavior.
The goal of an IDS is to dectect intrusions and create alerts without interfering with the organization's traffic.

section.title: What is an IPS?
section.para: IPS is an Intrusion Prevention System that works in the network or networks inside an organization.

It works in the same way as an IDS (in fact, it is usually the same software with an adapted behavior), except that in this case it does interfere with the organization's traffic, in that way when an attack is detected the system can choose between showing alerts or even discard the packets, creating the same effect as a firewall.
The configuration and registration of the IPS/IDS sensors into the Manager is the next step to the installation one. This process consists in two steps:

listitem.para: Installation and registration of the IPS/IDS sensors in the Manager
Configuration of basic parameters of the IPS/IDS sensors in the redborder platform

section.title: Basic Configuration

note.title: Note
note.para: To make this installation and configuration process it is necessary to login with the user with highest permissions: root.

section.para: Start the configuration manager by executing:
This menu consists of 5 options:

listitem.para: System Configuration: from this option you can define basic settings such as hostname, date, time, etc.
Network Configuration: this is the option where you can configure the network settings.
Passwords: access this option if you want to change your passwords.
Update rules from Manager: select this option to force the download of the Manager rules (optional).
quit: exit.

section.title: Network configuration
section.para: IDS/IPS sensors need to comunicate with the el Manager, to make this possible it is necessary to make the network configuration. Select option 2) Network Configuration from the redborder configuration menu.
Until this setting is not made properly, it will not be possible to register the sensor in the Manager..
These are the steps you need to follow to configure the network of your sensor:

listitem.para: Management Network Configuration:
a) Bonding creation and management interface assignment.
b) Segments configuration.
DNS and domain configuration

note.title: Note
note.para: The order to configure the management network can be different. The order indicated in this installation manual is the one considered most optimal.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: In case that the system is installed on a real computer that has more than one network card, the user must choose which will be the management bonding.

section.title: Interface assignment and bonding creation
section.para: Select Network Configuration typing 2 and press Enter.

caption.para: Automatic assignment of segments with bypass

section.para: In case the system recognizes interfaces with bypass, these will be automatically assigned to the segments..
To configure the network configuration correctly:

listitem.para: Bonding creation: (maximum 4 bonds).
Selection and assignment of bonding ports.
Management network interfaces selection for bonding.

section.para: The system will show a list with very valuable and detailed information, which will help the administrator to decide which ports are available for the creation of the bonding.

note.title: Note
note.para: To select the default options press: Enter

section.title: Creation of a new bonding and port assignment
section.para: To illustrate this process we will create a bonding (bond0) and assign 2 ports to it.
Select option n that appears in the submenu on the right side of the screen.
Once you have reviewed the ports that are available, select the one that you want to assign to bonding, as it appears in the lower margin of the previous screen.
Enter the port number on the line Insert bonding first port [0]:
The number in brackets [] it is the one that defines the system by default. To select this number press Enter.
The selected port will disappear from the available ports list.

important.title: Important
important.para: The system only allows a maximum of 4 bonds: (0-3).

section.title: Add a new port to bonding
section.para: The system will ask you the following question: Insert second port (y/N)
The default option is displayed in upper case. Remember that if you dont need to add a new port you only need to press Enter.
In case you want to insert a new port press y.
Enter the port number on the line Insert bonding second port [1]:
The number in brackets [] it is the one that defines the system by default. To select this number just press Enter.

section.title: Bonding network configuration
section.para: Once you have assigned the second port to the new bond (bond0), the system will ask you to enter the following data:

listitem.para: IP Address
Network mask
Gateway
Routes

section.para: If your device uses the DHCP protocol, it will be assigned a default IP address. Press Enter to select the IP, mask and gateway assigned by the system. Otherwise, manually enter these values.
The system also gives you a default route for the created bonding.
To insert a route manually, select the option y on the line Insert a route for this bonding (y/N)?:

caption.para: Manually add a route to the bonding

section.para: Once you have finished this process, you will see a message advising you that the Bonding has been successfully created: Bonding 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish the bonding creation process
section.para: Before applying changes and finishing the bonding creation process, the system will show you a table that shows the newly created bonding (bond0) together with the ports that have been assigned to it, the assigned IP and Mask and the route.
To save the settings select option a.
You can delete the created bond(s) at any time by selecting the option delete bonding pressing the key d.
To return to the main network configuration menu, select the option quit pressing q.

section.title: DNS and domain configuration
section.para: In the network configuration menu we find the option DNS and domain settings. To start the process, select option2.
To perform the configuration correctly, the user must enter:

listitem.para: Domain name
Primary DNS address
Secondary DNS address (optional)

section.para: Once this information has been entered, the system will warn that this configuration has been applied correctly.
To finish the process, it is not necessary to apply changes, select the option quit pressing q to return to the network settings main menu.

section.title: Network segments configuration
section.para: Select in the Network Configuration Menu the option Segment settings pressing the number 3.
This screen shows the number of segments that have been created, the ports assigned to each segment and whether or not they have bypass support.
On this section you will find the following submenu:

listitem.para: f) force bypass autoassign: to automatic assignment of ports with bypass.
n) new segment: select to create a new segment.
d) delete segment: to delete a segment.
q) quit:exit.

section.para: To start creating the segment, select the option n) new segment.
The segment creation process includes the following actions:

listitem.para: Assignment of bypass interfaces to segments (optional).
Creation a segmenet: (max 16 segments).
Selecting and assigning ports to the segment

section.para: In order to select a port, a list with very valuable and detailed information will be displayed, which will help the administrator to decide on which ports the created segments will use.

section.title: Bypass interfaces selection
section.para: If the system detects bypass interfaces, they are automatically assigned to segments when you enter the network configuration menu.
There are also two other ways of assigning ports or interfaces with bypass to segments:

listitem.para: Force bypass autoassign: select option Force bypass auto assign in the segment configuration menu, entering the letter f.
Manual assignment: selecting the ports with bypass from the list of available ports that will be displayed in the process of creating the segments.

section.title: Creating a new segment and assigning ports
section.para: To illustrate this process we will create a segment (segment 0) and assign 2 ports to it.
To start the segment creation process, select the option n that appears in the submenu on the right side of the screen.
Once you have reviewed the ports that are available, select the one you want to assign to the segment as it appears in the lower margin of the previous screen.
Enter the segment number on the line Insert segment number (0-15) [0]:
Th number in brackets [] it is the one that defines the system by default. To select this number press Enter.
The port previously assigned to the segment will disappear from the list of available ports.

note.title: Note
note.para: The system only allows the creation of a maximum of 16 segments (0-15).

section.title: Add a second port to the segmentt
section.para: Once you have assigned the first port to the segment, the system will ask you to assign a second port: Assign second port to the segment (Y/n):
The default option is displayed in upper case.
Remember that if you want to assign a new port you only have to press the key Enter.
In case you dont want to assign a new port, type n. Select an available port from the list.
Enter the port number on the line Insert segment second port [3]:

caption.para: Assign a new port to the segment

section.para: Once both ports have been assigned to a segment, the system will notify you that the segment has been successfully created: Segment 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish the process of creating the segments
section.para: Before applying changes and finishing the segment creation process, you will see a screen with a list that includes the following elements:

listitem.para: Segments
Ports assigned to the segment
Whether or not it has bypass support

caption.para: Summary of assigned segments and ports

section.para: You can delete in any moment the created segments by selection delete segment, pressing d.
To return to the main network configuration menu, select the option quit by pressing q.
To save the settings press a.
